text.tspan: What is it to believe someone?
[Is there such thing as a religion being 'true'? In what sense?]
intransigent intolerance of pagan superstition and
idolatry which Anscombe sees as essential to the
is a sort of worldly tolerance, as in the Roman Empire
the Hindu attitude that all the gods are manifestations of the one god,
the rather similar assumption, made by followers of Wittgenstein,
that religious truth is only really to be found in the spirituality of the individual,
that this is the place where religions touch internally,
and that the common truth in all religions is this human spirituality
The question that she leaves us with is why this spirituality should matter .
there is no such thing as
the true religion or the true
something rich and significant in the depths of the self is "the string which the pearls of all religions can hang"
it is comptemtible to be scornful of peoples for having gods: what matters is whether
there is this depth in a man's heart
Formulation of a strain of thought found on Wittgenstein followers
there is no such thing as a religion's being true; "this religious proposition isn't like a proposition of natural science"
religious belief is better compared to somebody's being in love than to his believing anything ture or false
someone who has been taught to pray finds out that you have to be completely honest for your utterance to count as prayer
Understanding or realisation related to religion consists in an attitude towards something one learns he ought to have
A religious expression or a proposition meant religiously is giving an expression to something that 'runs up against the limits of language' as such
is a misuse of words as far as concerns any sense that can be put on them. You posses it in a way that is immune to the idea of refuting examples
this pamphlet shows her view of the relation of faith and reason:
she does not try to use reason to explain how transubstantiation is possible,
but sees the task of reason as being to reply to reasoned arguments for the
if you believe in it, you believe that each claim to disprove it as contradictory can be answered
